ALLEGATION:
Youth assaulted another youth at the facility with an extension cord, resulting in
injuries. Assaults have been occurring daily. There is a concern for appropriate
supervision. Youth shares a room with the other youth and has requested to be
moved.
INVESTIGATION:
This complaint was received on 10/12/2022 and was investigated in collaboration
with DHHS Specialist.
I interviewed Youth A’s Foster Care Worker via telephone on 10/12/2022. She
received a telephone call from Youth A on 10/11/2022, and he told her he was
involved in a fight with another youth and the other youth hit him with an extension
cord. He had also attempted to AWOL and staff followed him. Youth A told her staff
were present and followed him. She reported there has been several incidents
involving Youth A being involved in fights, but she is always notified. She said Youth
A can be very manipulative. She denied Youth A is sharing a room with another
youth but said Youth A told her he wants to be moved to a different facility.
I interviewed Director of Residential Services on 10/12/2022 at the facility, in
collaboration with the DHHS Specialist. He reported there was an incident on
10/11/2022, involving Youth A and Youth B and Youth C got involved because Youth
B is a lot younger than Youth A. The incident occurred outside in the courtyard. He
said there were several staff members outside and they immediately intervened and
separated the youths. He reported the youths involved did not report being injured
and therefore a medical exam was not completed. He provided a copy of the
incident report. DHHS Specialist requested a medical exam be completed on Youth
A. Director reported that Youth A does not want to be at the facility and has
requested to be moved. He denied Youth A shares a room with another youth. He
reported each youth has his own bedroom. He reported last month Youth A was
moved from Juhnke Cottage to Harrison Cottage because he had an issue with
another youth.
Youth A was interviewed on 10/12/2022 at the facility, in collaboration with the
DHHS Specialist. Youth A is 16 years old and has been at the facility for four
months. He is currently in Harrison Cottage. He said he was originally in Juhnke
Cottage but was moved to Harrison cottage last month. He reported on 10/11/2022
he was playing basketball outside and Youth B got mad him because he refused to
get the basketball. Youth A ran inside the cottage. Youth B followed him and
grabbed a plunger from the bathroom and tried to hit him. Youth A grabbed the
plunger and threw it outside. Youth A grabbed Youth B’s Nintendo Switch, ran
outside, and tried to break it. Youth B followed him with the Nintendo charging cord
and was swinging it at Youth A. Youth A grabbed the cord and that’s when Youth C
came at him and pushed him to the ground. Youth A admitted to punching Youth B
in the face and that’s when Youth C pushed him to the ground. Youth A said Staff 1
3

was present and was talking, trying to deescalate the situation, and attempted to
separate them by standing between him and Youth B. Youth A reported there were
two other staff members that also intervened. Youth A denied having any issues with
the kids in Harrison Cottage but does have issues with the kids in Juhnke Cottage.
Youth A asked several times during the interview if he could be moved to another
facility. Youth A reported he has his own room and does not share a room with
another youth.
Youth B was interviewed on 10/12/2022 at the facility, in collaboration with the
DHHS Specialist. Youth B reported he and Youth A were playing basketball and
Youth A kicked the ball and refused to go get it. He said Youth A then went in the
cottage and got Youth B’s Nintendo Switch and tried to break it. Youth B grabbed a
plunger and threw at Youth A. Youth A ran outside with the Nintendo Switch, so
Youth B ran after Youth A and swung at him with the charging cord. Youth A
punched Youth B in the face and that’s when Youth C pushed Youth A to the
ground. Youth B reported Staff 2 was in the cottage and Staff 1 was outside. He said
Staff 1 was attempting to break up the fight and Staff 3 and the Therapist assisted in
breaking up the fight. Youth B reported feeling safe at the facility and did not express
any issues or concerns regarding staff or other youths.
Youth C was interviewed on 10/12/2022 at the facility, in collaboration with the
DHHS Specialist. Youth C reported he witnessed Youth A hit Youth C in the face, so
he ran and slammed Youth A to the ground. He said Youth B is a lot younger and
smaller than Youth A and he didn’t think it was fair that Youth A was picking on
Youth B. He said Staff 1 was attempting to separate Youth A and B, and Staff 3 and
the Therapist immediately intervened and walked him back to his cottage. Youth C
reported staff always intervene and will try to stop fights. Youth C reported feeling
safe and expressed no concerns regarding staff.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 10/12/2022 at the facility, in collaboration with the DHHS
Specialist. She has been working at the facility for three years. Staff 1 was on shift
with Staff 2 and assigned to Harrison Cottage on 10/11/2022. Staff 1 was
supervising the youths outside on 10/11/2022, when Youth A and B got into a fight.
Staff 2 was inside the cottage. Staff 1 saw Youth A run inside cottage and Youth B
followed him, but they were not arguing or fighting. A minute later Youth A came
outside and threw a plunger. Youth A and B then started to argue and kick each
other. She attempted to deescalate the situation verbally and by redirecting the
boys. Youth C got involved when he picked up Youth A and slammed him on the
floor. Staff 3 and the Therapist immediately intervened by separating the boys and
walked Youth C back to his cottage. Youth A started to walk to the back of the
facility, so she followed him and tried to calm him down. She denied that staff were
not outside supervising the boys. She said Youth A denied being injured or hurt.
Youth B did have a small scratch above his left eye.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 10/12/2022 at the facility, in collaboration with the DHHS
Specialist. Staff 2 has been working at the facility for 3 months as a youth specialist.
4

She has completed all her training including CPI. She was working with Staff 1 on
10/11/2022. Staff 1 was outside supervising the youths that were playing outside
and Staff 2 was in the cottage preparing dinner. She reported Youth A came inside
and told her not to let Youth B come inside. Youth B came in and he and Youth A
started to argue, then Youth B went to the bathroom and grabbed a plunger. Youth A
took the plunger and ran outside. She said both boys ran back outside. She said
both boys were only verbally arguing, and she did not witness them get physical with
each other. She did redirect them and told them to stop arguing. Staff 2 denied
Youth A is being bullied or targeted by the other youths. She reported Youth A is
usually the one that instigates and starts fights with the other youths. She said Youth
A returned to the cottage after the fight and he did not report having any injuries.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 10/12/2022 at the facility, in collaboration with the DHHS
Specialist. Staff 3 is a youth specialist and is assigned to Juhnke Cottage. He was
outside on 10/11/2022 and witnessed Youth C run and pick up Youth A and slam
him on the ground. He and the Therapist immediately went over and assisted Staff 1
in separating the boys. He reported the youths were separated and redirected back
to their cottages. He denied any of the youths were restrained. He said Staff 1 was
outside supervising the youths and she was attempting to verbally deescalate the
situation. He said Youth A was originally placed Juhnke Cottage, but last month was
moved to Harrison Cottage because he was involved in a fight with another resident.
He denied Youth A is a target and denied he has been threatened by other youths.
Therapist 1 was interviewed on 10/12/2022 at the facility, in collaboration with the
DHHS Specialist. Therapist 1 was outside on 10/11/2022 and heard the children
yelling. He saw Youth A swing and hit Youth B in the face. He and Staff 3 ran to
assist and that’s when Youth C ran and slammed Youth A to the ground. He and the
other staff separated the boys, and Staff 3 walked Youth C back to his cottage.
Therapist 1 said that Youth C said he intervened because Youth A is older and
bigger than Youth B. Therapist 1 denied witnessing Youth B hit Youth A with a cord.
Youth A told him the argument started over Youth B kicking the ball away from
Youth A. Therapist 1 met with Youth A after the fight and Youth A denied being
injured or needing medical attention.
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed on 10/12/2022 at the facility, in
collaboration with the DHHS Specialist. CA reported staff were outside supervising
the youths and immediately intervened and separated the boys. She said Youth A
antagonizes and starts the fights with the other residents. She said there was an
incident involving another youth in Juhnke Cottage and Youth A was moved to
Harrison Cottage. She will be meeting with the clinical staff to identify and address
Youth A’s triggers, so they can incorporate them into his treatment plan and therapy.
Documents review for the investigation:
• Incident report dated 10/11/2022. Youth A and Youth B were arguing in the
courtyard. Youth A punched Youth B in the face, Youth C came from behind
5

and slammed Youth A to the ground. Youth A proceeded to walk to the back
of the campus. Youth A was followed by Staff 3 and redirected back to the
cottage.
• Youth A medical exam completed by Nurse on 10/14/2022. Youth A has a
small scratch on his right side of his face above his jaw, a scab on his arm
and a bruise on his left leg. Youth A reported the scab on his arm and bruise
on his leg were from playing sports.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4126 The licensee shall have a sufficient number of
administrative, supervisory, social service, direct care, and
other staff to perform the prescribed functions required by
these administrative rules and to provide for the needs,
protection, and supervision of residents.
(1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of
administrative, supervisory, social service, direct care, and
other staff to perform the prescribed functions required by
these administrative rules and to provide for the needs,
protection, and supervision of residents.
(2) One direct care worker shall be responsible for not more
than 10 residents at one time during residents' normal
awake hours and not more than 20 residents at one time
during the residents' normal sleeping hours.
ANALYSIS: There is in insufficient evidence to support the allegations that
staff are not supervising youths. Youths and staff involved in the
altercation were interviewed and reported that staff members
were present, attempted to deescalated, intervened, and
separated the youths involved.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on the findings of this investigation, I recommend no change to the current
license status.
